name: Janusz Kaminski
title: Director of Photography
bio: 3-time Oscar winner and Steven Spielberg's primary cinematographer. Master of emotional lighting and revolutionary color science. Known for transforming digital cinematography into emotional storytelling.

signature_look.description: Ultra-naturalistic cinematography with poetic color grading. Desaturated primary colors with selective warm/cool accents. Intimate handheld combined with sweeping crane movements. Masterful use of shadows and highlights for emotional depth.
signature_look.key_characteristic: Emotional depth through lighting - creates psychological mood through subtle color temperature shifts and motivated practicals
signature_look.legendary_technique: Pioneered digital color grading for emotional storytelling in major studio films; pioneered green-and-gold color palette as emotional language

primary_cameras.name: Panavision System 65
primary_cameras.use_case: Epic scope sequences, establishing moments of grandeur, war sequences

primary_cameras.name: Alexa 65
primary_cameras.use_case: High dynamic range storytelling, intimate character drama

primary_cameras.name: Panavision Millennium XL
primary_cameras.use_case: Character-driven moments, emotional intimacy, legacy anamorphic look

film_stock_emulation.name: Kodak Vision3 500T
film_stock_emulation.characteristics: Fine grain, warm color bias, classic film emulation

film_stock_emulation.name: Kodak Vision3 200T
film_stock_emulation.characteristics: Ultra-fine grain, silky smooth, digital-like cleanliness

technical_specialties.lighting_approach: Motivated practical lights with carefully balanced key/fill ratio. Often uses warm tungsten with cool practical sources to create emotional contrast. Shadows carry meaning, not just darkness.
technical_specialties.color_science: Desaturated primary colors with selective saturation on emotional beats. Warm ambers and cool blues as emotional anchors. Green-and-gold palette for hope and victory.
technical_specialties.exposure_philosophy: Expose for highlights, maintain shadow detail, use full dynamic range for emotional depth. Crushed blacks reserved for moments of darkness or loss.
technical_specialties.dynamic_range_preference: 14+ stops, fully utilize sensor capability for maximum visual information
frame_rate_preference: Variable frame rates for emotional emphasis

director_collaboration.communication_style: Deep visual collaboration - builds mood through light and color to support director's emotional narrative intent. Silent communicator; lets images speak.
director_collaboration.strengths_with_narrative: Transforms emotional subtext into visual language. Expert at conveying psychological states through lighting. Makes audiences FEEL before they understand.

must_have_characteristics: Sophisticated lighting ratios with motivated sources
Desaturated color palette with emotional accents
Shallow depth of field with pin-sharp focus on performance
Warm/cool color temperature contrast as emotional language
Professional cinema camera composition and framing
technical_mandates: Shoot on 65mm equivalent digital format (Alexa 65 standard)
Anamorphic lens aesthetic (Panavision preferred for vintage, Zeiss for modern precision)
Kodak film stock emulation (warm grain texture for intimacy)
Professional cinema lighting setup (no flat digital look)
Masterful exposure control - full dynamic range utilization
avoid: Flat digital look without emotional lighting
Unnatural color grading that doesn't serve emotion
Artificial lighting that doesn't feel motivated by story
Oversaturated colors without selective color emphasis
emphasis_on: Emotional lighting that supports performance and subtext
Color as narrative and psychological language
Classical cinema aesthetics executed with modern precision
Visual storytelling through light, shadow, and color
Making audiences feel the emotional truth
